intro: Clethra scabra var. venosa, commonly known as the veined clethra, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and fragrant white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Its varietal name, *venosa*, refers to the prominent veins on its leaves, which are a distinguishing feature of this cultivar.
